Package com.deliburd.extrataskschedulers

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AutoShutdownExecutorService
    An interface that specifies an ExecutorService that can shut down automatically when the JVM terminates gracefully.
    CallbackExecutorService
    An interface that specifies an ExecutorService that can have tasks submitted to it and returns a CallbackFuture upon submission.
    CallbackFuture<V>
    A Future that has methods to add callbacks that execute after completion of the computation whether it be due to success, failure, or cancellation.
    StealingCallbackExecutorService
    An interface that specifies an ExecutorService that merges the StealingExecutorService and CallbackExecutorService interfaces and provides overridden task submission methods that return StealingCallbackFutures.
    StealingCallbackFuture<V>
    A Future that has methods to do work in the executor linked to it while waiting for a computation's result.
    StealingExecutorService
    An interface that specifies an ExecutorService that can have work stolen from it and provides methods for enabling and disabling work stealing along with a method to check if work stealing is allowed.
    StealingFuture<V>
    A Future that has methods to do work in the executor linked to it while waiting for a computation's result.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    StealingCallbackExecutor
    A ThreadPoolExecutor which has three main features added to it and the Future it returns, StealingCallbackFuture
    StealingCallbackExecutors
    A static utility class containing methods to get different StealingCallbackExecutors including fixed thread pools, cached thread pools, and single thread executors.
    StealingCallbackFutureTask<V>
    A FutureTask that can do work in the executor linked to it if one is provided and can have work stolen from it while waiting for a computation's result.
